alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 11:03AM PDT until May 13 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Battle Mountain. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. A few rural roads begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM PDT Saturday, May 13 the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM PDT Saturday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 8.6 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 03/30/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday at 100 PM PDT.
